result.title: Welcome to Workflow Studio!
result.content: Workflow Studio provides a single place to create, edit, and monitor workflows. Manage your playbooks, flows, subflows, actions, data streams, and decision tables.
result.name: Introduction

result.content:
You have the option to set required and optional parameters for your new page.

A required parameter is a piece of data that your page must have, such as a sys_id, table, or query. Required parameters are useful for components, because they can bind to the value of the required parameter.

result.title: How to navigate experience view
result.content:
Welcome! This guided tour will provide you with information about UI Builder experiences and what they contain.

UI Builder experience view is a central place to understand the structure and details of an experience.
result.name: Introduction

result.content: Click Create shift.

View the App shell of the experience.

The app shell is the experience âwrapper.â App shells can include items like a logo in the header and icons in the footer.

The app shell is specified when creating the experience and cannot be changed.
Click to open a breakdown mapping record

result.content:
In any page variant row, you can select Editor to open the variant and customize the page.

Do not select Editor now. Instead, select the Next button to continue the guided tour.

Because you created the page from scratch, the Content tree contains no column layouts or components. You simply have a blank page to which you can add the elements you need.
Give this new variant a unique name.
Use the Data and scripts panel to manage data resources, client state parameters, and client scripts used on the component. There is a search bar if you need to search through a very long list.

You can get an overview of catalog tasks and unresolved incidents assigned to you or your team, and also the tasks delegated to you by other agents.

result.title: Get Tailored Recommendations for Problems
result.content: Use the Recommendations () icon in the contextual side panel to get the actionable recommendations that can help you to speed up the triaging and resolve issues quickly.
result.name: Introduction

result.content:
Node and Arc popup and optionsâ

The Inspection section serves as a detailed analytical suite for nodes and arcs.â

Show Records: Reveals the specific records that pass through a selected node or arc, providing a detailed account of the data flow within the process.â

Work notes Analysis: Clusters records based on the similarity of agent work notes, offering insights into the reasons behind specific process transitions.â

Requestor intent (Cluster): Sorts records into clusters according to their descriptive attributes, aiding in the understanding of their underlying requestor intent.â

Key Contributors (RCA): Identifies and highlights the dimensions most associated with certain inefficiencies, shining a light on potential areas for process improvement.â

Filter on transitions: Concentrates on refining the process examination to specific transitions, allowing for a more targeted and narrowed analysis.
You can access this tour again from Resources on the Homepage.
result.name: Conclusion

result.content:
Analyst Workbenchâ

Welcome to the Analyst Workbench, where you are equipped with advanced tools for a granular examination of your process workflows. As you look at the map, you'll notice it is populated with activity nodes and arc metrics, each providing a snapshot of your process's flow and performance.â

Now Assist uses this description to draft the flow that you'll review and edit. Tips for best results:

  • Start by describing the flow trigger and data conditions.
  • Describe actions and flow logic in the order that you want them to happen.
  • Include as much detail as possible.
result.name: AI Prompt

result.content: Select the Recommendations () icon in the contextual side panel.

Process mapââ

Embark on a journey through your process data with our Interactive Process Map. This dynamic visualization is specifically tailored to show the actual process flows based on your process audit data. â

It offers tailored visualization to identify and analyze specific problems within your workflow, featuring a comprehensive view of process steps and transitions through nodes and arcs, along with in-depth metrics such as total and unique occurrences, duration extremes, average, and variability, to measure performance and identify inefficiencies.
Click this button to create new Data Source and link M2M record

You may want certain conditions to have a higher priority than others.

The lower the number, the higher the priority.

result.name: SLA Schedule source field

result.content: Provide a name, table and condition to determine when this view configuration will be applied

Process overview

Dive into the heart of your projectâs process with the Project Metrics, a section dedicated to showing your process time efficiency and bottlenecks. â

Time Series Graphâ
Watch the evolution of your process efficiency over time with a trendline graph that displays the average time taken from the first event until the last project record. This visualization helps you identify patterns, trends, and anomalies in your process performance, enabling you to dive deeper into certain time areas.â

Histogramâ
Gain a deeper understanding of your process efficiency with a histogram that categorizes records by the time taken to reach the process end. This graph offers a visual representation of how your records are distributed across different time frames, highlighting potential areas for improvement in speeding up process completion.â

â KPI Dashboardsââ
You can also include your overall process KPI dashboard to determine impact of your project performance on the overall process KPIâs

Automate with Actions and Flow Logic

Automate your work with actions. Control how your actions run with flow logic.
You can toggle between your assignments and your teamâs assignments using the Your work drop-down.
Select the type of agreement. The selected value is used to sort or search for SLAs by type.

result.content: Select to enable event logging for the SLA. The log data provides information regarding related task events and should only be used for debugging.

result.content:
Scheduled tasksâ

Your central command for tracking and retrieving the outputs of ad-hoc process mining tasks. This interface is crafted to keep you informed about the progress of ad-hoc mining tasks, and allows you to open completed tasks. â

Instantly view the status of your on-demand tasks. Whether queued, in progress, experiencing errors, or completed, you have a complete, real-time update of each task's current state.â

Once a task like a cluster analysis or an applied filter view is complete, access its results directly from the pane.
The page opens in a preview overlay.
Select External URL.

Scroll down in the list and select Name.

Select next in this guide, then click OK below.
ClickÂ More options

Summary and Insightsâ

This Summary and insights page is your central hub for understanding and enhancing your project's process performance. Let's briefly dive into what you'll find here:

Project Metrics
  • Number of Records: Understand the scope of your project with the total records processed.â
  • Process Variation: See the number of different routes and variations in your processes, highlighting complexity and areas for simplification.â
  • Performance Statistics: Get a snapshot of time efficiency with average, standard deviation, and median durations of records. These metrics are crucial for identifying bottlenecks and improving process speeds.â
âMetrics graphâ
At a Glance: View essential metrics at the top to quickly assess your project's performance against overall project and process KPIâs.â

â Improvement Opportunitiesâ
Dive into specific opportunities for actionable insights on where to focus your improvement efforts.â

result.content:
Improvement Opportunitiesâ

Instantly discover the most significant areas for process optimization within your project. This powerful tool automatically detects patterns or rules that point out inefficiencies such as rework, extra steps, ping pong, and extreme outliers. â â
â
Overviewâ
Understand how these inefficiencies impact your Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). This analysis helps you prioritize improvement opportunities based on their potential to enhance overall performance and achieve strategic objectives. Also, track what actions have been taken to mitigate these issues.

Opportunities ââ
Instant Identification: Utilize our advanced analytics to automatically identify patterns indicating major inefficiencies in your processes. This immediate insight allows you to focus on the most impactful improvement opportunities without sifting through data manually.â

You can accept or reject the absence requests here. Resolve the gaps and conflicts occurring in the shift due to holiday schedules or shift member's time-off request.

You can also add or remove members to a shift, schedule extra-time, provide coverage, and override their contact preferences.

result.content: The Password Reset for Service Operations Workspace application enforces strong and secure passwords by enabling end users to reset or change their passwords by requesting the service desk agent. result.content:
Breakdownsââ

The Breakdown section serves as a powerful slicing tool for your process graph, allowing you to dissect and reassemble the workflow based on real record attributes. For instance, you can filter the process map to display data exclusive to a certain channel or business service, offering a customizable view that hones in on specific segments of your operation for detailed analysis. Breakdown statistics helps to pinpoint process slicing and dicing based on actual performance issues.
Save
Click Apply.
Check that the fields used in the additional conditions are correct
result.name: Check Additional Conditions

result.content:
Provide the required details to create a new shift and enable the Create Shift button.

Note:

  • Create new is the default selection.
  • Select Use template to use a predefined template.
  • Enable All day shift for a day-long commitment
  • Select More options to add more details.

Variation Analysisâââ

Variation Analysis offers a comprehensive perspective on the different routes and variations within your process, complete with detailed statistics such as the number of steps per variant, performance metrics like duration, and the record count for each variant. It enables users to select one or multiple variants to conduct a in-depth performance inspection by filtering the entire progress graph.
Provide a name and save this configuration then use related lists to configure datasources, view configs and data filters
Select sys_id.

Use the homepage to create and view workflows. You can see a list of workflows by type, a list of workflows you last worked on, a list of recent workflow updates, and a list of information resources.

When you preview using the Open URL path option, you are testing which variant users see. UI Builder checks the audience, conditions, and condition order, and then opens the appropriate variant in a new browser tab.

Just like the first preview option, you can test the components on the page by selecting buttons, filling in forms, and checking data resources. Select the Open URL path option now and when you are finished testing in the new browser tab, close the tab to return to this tour.

  • Defects
  • Enhancements
  • Improvement initiatives

You can add, create, or remove related fix task records from the problem.

An App shell UI is a wrapper for the contents of an experience.

For example, the Workspace App Shell includes the headers and footers for a workspace experience. The UXR Base Experience shell creates a simple experience with the Next Experience banner.

Select the field, and then select an app shell from the list.
Click update to save your changes even if you didn't make any. You will return to the indicator source list.

Select a workflow type to see operational charts such as most executed playbooks and playbook executions by state.
A URL path is automatically added based on the name you specified. You can change the path, but it must be unique.
Select the schedule that determines the hours during which the SLA runs.

result.content:
The Overview section provides a summary of various assignments such as incidents and catalog tasks. You can get an overview of catalog tasks and unresolved incidents assigned to you or your team, and also the tasks delegated to you by other agents.

Important:

  • When you select any part of the donut, the associated records are displayed in a list view below the donuts.
  • When you select the number at the center of the donut, all records associated with that card are displayed in a list view below the donuts.

Select Create.

Your new page may take a moment to load.
Use the Communicate tab to view and manage the incident related communications.

View the Roles associated with the experience.

Roles control access to the experience. One or more roles may be listed.

Process comparisonââ

âIt assist you in evaluating the efficiency of your processes by juxtaposing your current process graph with an ideal or designed process graph. After pinpointing inefficiencies, it enables you to conduct conformance checking to identify discrepancies between the actual process flow and the theoretical model. Through this comparison, you can quickly discern where your process graph and its breakdowns diverge from the envisioned ideal, facilitating targeted improvements and alignment with best practices.â

Model optionsâ

Welcome to the Model Options where customizing and refining your process graph is made simple and efficient. These features are designed to give you control over how you view and analyze your process.â

Activities and Connections Sliderâ
Adjust the Activities and Connections slider to zoom in on the process graph. This tool allows you to focus on the intricacies of your workflow, down to the finest detail.â

Perspectivesâ
Utilize the Perspectives feature to assess your process from a selected viewpoint. By filtering out all activities except those that match a specific definition, you can isolate segments of your workflow for targeted perspective analysis.
Click here to add a new action for this view configuration
Select Save.

Process Mining FAQ - ServiceNow Community article covering some of the most common Process Mining questions.

result.title: Building components

Welcome! This guided tour will provide you with information about navigating Component Building Editor view.

Component Building Editor view is where you can edit a reusable custom component with column layouts and sub-components.

result.name: SLA Workflow

result.content: In the configuration panel, select None â Configure the component manually.

Select the method for calculating the duration of the SLA:

  • User specified duration
    This is a static duration such as 8 hours

  • Choose a relative duration
    Relative Durations are defined as individual records accessed via the Relative Durations module.

    Each Relative duration uses a script to calculate the Breach time of the SLA, for example, End of next business day
